description.content: The value to be returned to the upper context.

documentation.content: Specifies the value that will be returned to the upper context. When this node executes, it immediately halts the iteration and passes the value upward.

description.content: Returns a value and terminates the current context.

documentation.content: Ends the current context and returns the specified value to the upper scope. This node behaves like a standard 'return' statement in programming languages, stopping further execution within the current flow.
